snippet: The big-budget flop from 20th Century Fox added to fears about superhero fatigue and called into question Hollywood’s willingness to hire novice directors for major films.
abstract: Disappointing opening-weekend box office performance for Josh Trank movie Fantastic Four may be sign that audiences are growing tired of superhero films and could mean end to Hollywood fad of giving big-budget projects to novice directors; $26.2 million in tickets were sold for movie in North America, far below $40 million forecast by box office analysts.
lead_paragraph: The big-budget flop from 20th Century Fox added to fears about superhero fatigue and called into question Hollywood’s willingness to hire novice directors for major films.

headline.main: ‘Fantastic Four’ Lacks Superpowers at Box Office
headline.print_headline: Film Heroes Are Bested at Box Office
